member.name: T:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryAccessor
member.summary: Provides random access to unmanaged blocks of memory from managed code.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryAccessor.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryAccessor.#ctor(System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeBuffer,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified buffer, offset, and capacity.
member.param: The buffer to contain the accessor.
The byte at which to start the accessor.
The size, in bytes, of memory to allocate.
member.exception: plus is greater than .
is null.
or is less than zero.
plus would wrap around the high end of the address space.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryAccessor.#ctor(System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeBuffer,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.IO.FileAccess)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified buffer, offset, capacity, and access right.
member.param: The buffer to contain the accessor.
The byte at which to start the accessor.
The size, in bytes, of memory to allocate.
The type of access allowed to the memory. The default is .
member.exception: plus is greater than .
is null.
or is less than zero.-or- is not a valid enumeration value.
plus would wrap around the high end of the address space.

member.name: P:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryAccessor.CanRead
member.summary: Determines whether the accessor is readable.
member.returns: true if the accessor is readable; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryAccessor.CanWrite
member.summary: Determines whether the accessory is writable.
member.returns: true if the accessor is writable; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryAccessor.Capacity
member.summary: Gets the capacity of the accessor.
member.returns: The capacity of the accessor.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryAccessor.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the .

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryAccessor.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryAccessor.Initialize(System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeBuffer,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.IO.FileAccess)
member.summary: Sets the initial values for the accessor.
member.param: The buffer to contain the accessor.
The byte at which to start the accessor.
The size, in bytes, of memory to allocate.
The type of access allowed to the memory. The default is .
member.exception: plus is greater than .
is null.
or is less than zero.-or- is not a valid enumeration value.
plus would wrap around the high end of the address space.

member.name: P:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryAccessor.IsOpen
member.summary: Determines whether the accessor is currently open by a process.
member.returns: true if the accessor is open; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryAccessor.ReadBoolean(System.Int64)
member.summary: Reads a Boolean value from the accessor.
member.returns: true or false.
member.param: The number of bytes into the accessor at which to begin reading.
member.exception: There are not enough bytes after to read a value.
is less than zero or greater than the capacity of the accessor.

member.name: T:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream
member.summary: Provides access to unmanaged blocks of memory from managed code.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.exception: The user does not have the required permission.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.#ctor(System.Byte*,System.Int64)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified location and memory length.
member.param: A pointer to an unmanaged memory location.
The length of the memory to use.
member.exception: The user does not have the required permission.
The value is null.
The value is less than zero.- or -The is large enough to cause an overflow.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.#ctor(System.Byte*,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.IO.FileAccess)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified location, memory length, total amount of memory, and file access values.
member.param: A pointer to an unmanaged memory location.
The length of the memory to use.
The total amount of memory assigned to the stream.
One of the values.
member.exception: The user does not have the required permission.
The value is null.
The value is less than zero.- or - The value is less than zero.- or -The value is greater than the value.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.#ctor(System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeBuffer,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class in a safe buffer with a specified offset and length.
member.param: The buffer to contain the unmanaged memory stream.
The byte position in the buffer at which to start the unmanaged memory stream.
The length of the unmanaged memory stream.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.#ctor(System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeBuffer,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.IO.FileAccess)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class in a safe buffer with a specified offset, length, and file access.
member.param: The buffer to contain the unmanaged memory stream.
The byte position in the buffer at which to start the unmanaged memory stream.
The length of the unmanaged memory stream.
The mode of file access to the unmanaged memory stream.

member.name: P:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.CanRead
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a stream supports reading.
member.returns: false if the object was created by a constructor with an parameter that did not include reading the stream and if the stream is closed; otherwise, true.

member.name: P:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.CanSeek
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a stream supports seeking.
member.returns: false if the stream is closed; otherwise, true.

member.name: P:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.CanWrite
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a stream supports writing.
member.returns: false if the object was created by a constructor with an parameter value that supports writing or was created by a constructor that had no parameters, or if the stream is closed; otherwise, true.

member.name: P:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.Capacity
member.summary: Gets the stream length (size) or the total amount of memory assigned to a stream (capacity).
member.returns: The size or capacity of the stream.
member.exception: The stream is closed.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.Flush
member.summary: Overrides the method so that no action is performed.
member.exception: The stream is closed.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.FlushAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Overrides the method so that the operation is cancelled if specified, but no other action is performed.Available starting in .NET Framework 2015
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous flush operation.
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.Initialize(System.Byte*,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.IO.FileAccess)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using a pointer to an unmanaged memory location.
member.param: A pointer to an unmanaged memory location.
The length of the memory to use.
The total amount of memory assigned to the stream.
One of the values.
member.exception: The user does not have the required permission.
The value is null.
The value is less than zero.- or - The value is less than zero.- or -The value is large enough to cause an overflow.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.Initialize(System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeBuffer,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.IO.FileAccess)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class in a safe buffer with a specified offset, length, and file access.
member.param: The buffer to contain the unmanaged memory stream.
The byte position in the buffer at which to start the unmanaged memory stream.
The length of the unmanaged memory stream.
The mode of file access to the unmanaged memory stream.

member.name: P:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.Length
member.summary: Gets the length of the data in a stream.
member.returns: The length of the data in the stream.
member.exception: The stream is closed.

member.name: P:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the current position in a stream.
member.returns: The current position in the stream.
member.exception: The stream is closed.
The position is set to a value that is less than zero, or the position is larger than or results in overflow when added to the current pointer.

member.name: P:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.PositionPointer
member.summary: Gets or sets a byte pointer to a stream based on the current position in the stream.
member.returns: A byte pointer.
member.exception: The current position is larger than the capacity of the stream.
The position is being set is not a valid position in the current stream.
The pointer is being set to a lower value than the starting position of the stream.
The stream was initialized for use with a . The property is valid only for streams that are initialized with a pointer.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of bytes into the specified array.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to read from the current stream.
member.exception: The stream is closed.
The underlying memory does not support reading.- or - The property is set to false.
The parameter is set to null.
The parameter is less than zero. - or - The parameter is less than zero.
The length of the buffer array minus the parameter is less than the parameter.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.ReadAsync(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously reads the specified number of bytes into the specified array.Available starting in .NET Framework 2015
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous read operation. The value of the parameter contains the total number of bytes read into the buffer. The result value can be less than the number of bytes requested if the number of bytes currently available is less than the requested number, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the stream has been reached.
member.param: The buffer to write the data into.
The byte offset in at which to begin writing data from the stream.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from a stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.
member.returns: The unsigned byte cast to an object, or -1 if at the end of the stream.
member.exception: The stream is closed.
The underlying memory does not support reading.- or -The current position is at the end of the stream.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Sets the current position of the current stream to the given value.
member.returns: The new position in the stream.
member.param: The point relative to to begin seeking from.
Specifies the beginning, the end, or the current position as a reference point for , using a value of type .
member.exception: An attempt was made to seek before the beginning of the stream.
The value is larger than the maximum size of the stream.
is invalid.
The stream is closed.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the length of a stream to a specified value.
member.param: The length of the stream.
member.exception: An I/O error has occurred.
The stream is closed.
The underlying memory does not support writing.- or -An attempt is made to write to the stream and the property is false.
The specified exceeds the capacity of the stream.- or -The specified is negative.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a block of bytes to the current stream using data from a buffer.
member.param: The byte array from which to copy bytes to the current stream.
The offset in the buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to write to the current stream.
member.exception: The stream is closed.

The underlying memory does not support writing. - or -An attempt is made to write to the stream and the property is false.- or -The value is greater than the capacity of the stream.- or -The position is at the end of the stream capacity.
An I/O error occurs.
One of the specified parameters is less than zero.
The parameter minus the length of the parameter is less than the parameter.
The parameter is null.

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.WriteAsync(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream, advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written, and monitors cancellation requests.Available starting in .NET Framework 2015
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous write operation.
member.param: The buffer to write data from.
The zero-based byte offset in from which to begin copying bytes to the stream.
The maximum number of bytes to write.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .

member.name: M:System.IO.UnmanagedMemoryStream.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a byte to the current position in the file stream.
member.param: A byte value written to the stream.
member.exception: The stream is closed.
The underlying memory does not support writing.- or -An attempt is made to write to the stream and the property is false.- or - The current position is at the end of the capacity of the stream.
The supplied causes the stream exceed its maximum capacity.
